snippet: Customs officials confiscated the painting, valued at nearly $30 million, after its owner’s yacht left Spain for French waters.
abstract: Early Picasso painting, which Spanish authorities consider national treasure and had barred from being sold outside country, is seized by French customs officials from yacht owned by Jaime Botin, high-profile member of prominent Spanish banking family; authorities say Botin, enticed by booming art market, had intended to sell painting in Switzerland; Botin says protectionist law does not apply to work because it was bought abroad and kept aboard yacht registered in Britain.
lead_paragraph: Customs officials confiscated the painting, valued at nearly $30 million, after its owner’s yacht left Spain for French waters.

headline.main: Spain Says Banker’s Seized Picasso Will Head Back Home
headline.print_headline: Spain Says Banker’s Seized Picasso Will Head Back Home
